section.name: JAAS Configuration
section.p: The full name of the class implementing the login module is net.sf.jaasrimap.RIMAPLoginModule. A typical jaas.config file will look like this:
The location of the JAAS configuration file must be passed to the JVM in the java.security.auth.login.config system property:

section.name: Module options
section.p: The login module supports the following options:

tr.td: If this option is set to true, debugging is turned on. All debugging messages will be written to System.out.
The hostname of the IMAP server to connect to.
The protocol to use when talking to the IMAP server. Valid values are imap for plaintext IMAP or imaps for IMAP over SSL.
The port number of the IMAP server to connect to.
The timeout value in milliseconds to be used when connecting to the server. A value of 0 means the system default.
The timeout value in milliseconds to be used when reading replies from the server. A value of 0 means the system default.
If set to true the login module will use TLS, i.e. connects to the server in plaintext and then start SSL negociation using the STARTTLS protocol command. This option is ignored if protocol is imaps.

Specify whether the server certificate should be validated. This option is only relevant for IMAP over SSL or together with the usetls option. Setting this option to false may be required when the server has a self-signed certificate.

Specify the caching policy for successful logins. The value is specified as as integer and indicates the number of seconds to cache a successful login. A value of 0 disables caching. Note that unsuccesful logins are never cached.
